Check: Check the existence of the settings-file.
Check if the settings-file contains valid JSON.
Check the validity of the JSON-keys in the settings-file.
Comment: Required versus optional keys.

Check: Check the consistency of the JSON-keys in the settings-file.
Comment: Either indices or indicators, but not both.

Check: Check index names in the settings-file.
Check the number of indices in the settings-file.
Check the format of the weights in the settings-file.
Comment: Floating point format (0.333) and rational format (1/3) are both allowed.

Check: Check the consistency between the weights and the indicators in the settings-file.
Check the range of the weights in the settings-file.
Comment: Should be non-negative.

Check: Check the range of the confidence level in the settings-file.
Comment: Should be in [0.50, 0.99]

Check: Check consistency between weights and pressure in settings-file.
Comment: Weights should be given if pressure is missing.

Check: Check if the name and the unit of the pressure are given in the settings-file (if the pressure column has been found in the benthos-file).
Comment: BENMMI issues a warning and continues without pressure optimization.

Check: Check the range, the order, and the format of the months to analyse in the settings-file.
Comment: Range should be in  {1, 2, ..., 12},  first month <= second  month,  and format should be an integer vector of length 2.

Check: Check the format of Boolean (true/false) variables  in the settings-file.
Comment: E.g., enable data pooling, enable genus to species conversion.

Check: Check the format and the length of the seed to initialize the pseudo random number generator (needed for pooling).
Comment: Format should be an integer of length 1

Check: Check value of optional key 'legendText'.
Comment: should be either EQR or normalized.

Check: Check if all JSON-keys have been used.
Comment: Prevent typographical errors in optional keys.

Check: Check the existence of the benthos-file.
Check the column names of the benthos-file.
Check the uniqueness of the coordinates in the benthos-file.
Check the uniqueness of the sieve mesh in the benthos-file.
Check if BENMMI can be launched by means of a graphical user's interface.
Comment: GUIs are usually only implemented on desktops and not on servers.

Check: Check if the user presses the CANCEL-button or the ESC-button to cancel execution.
Check if the settings-file exists.
Check the existence of the species-file.
Check if the species-file can be read.
Check the existence of the `taxon-groups-to-exclude file'.
Check if the `taxon-groups-to-exclude file' can be read.
Check the existence of the `benthos-file'.
Check if the `benthos-file' can be read.
Check the consistency between weights and pressure.
Comment: Weights should be given when PRESSURE column is missing.

Check: Check the situtation when pressure has been specified in the settings-file but is missing in the benthos-file.
Check if the months specified in the settings-file are also in the benthos file.
Check the existence of the AMBI-file (if specified).
Check if the AMBI-file can be read.
Check if the AMBI-file is consistent: TAXON-AMBI class combinations should be unique after conversion to WoRMS.
Comment: Only the first TAXON-AMBI combination will be used.

Check: Check the existence of the AMBI-file (if specified).
Check if the ITI-file can be read.
Check if ITI-data are still consistent after conversion to WoRMS.
Check the existence of the habitat-reference file.
Check if the habitat-reference-file can be read.
Check if reference data are available for all records in the benthos-file.
Check if the BENMMI-report can be generated without errors.
Check if BENMMIdir can be launched by means of a graphical user's interface.
Comment: GUIs are usually only implemented on desktops and not on servers.

Check: Check if the user presses the CANCEL-button or the ESC-button to cancel execution.
Check if the BENMMI-direcory exists.
Check if the BENMMI-direcory is empty.
Comment: We don't want to accidentally overwrite existing files.

Check: Check if the following column names exists in the benthos-file: OBJECTID, HABITAT, SAMPLEID, TAXON,  AREA, DATE, VALUE, LAT, LONG, MESH.
Check if VALUE column in benthos-file is non-negative.
Check date-format.
Comment: All dates should adhere to ISO 8601 (YYYY-mm-dd)

Check: Check that all AREAs are unique for each sample (i.e., OBJECTID/SAMPLEID/DATE-combination).
Check on duplidated records.
Check on azoic samples with non-zero VALUE-column.
Comment: These abundances will be set to zero.

Check: Check if benthos file has still any records left after all checks.
Check if VALUE column contains integer values (abundances).
Comment: Fractional data may indicate fragments of species, but also species densities.

Check: Check if the taxa-file exists.
Check if the following column names exists in the taxa-file: group, provided, accepted, level.
Check if all taxa can be converted from provided to accepted names.
Comment: No missing values are allowed in the taxa-file.

Check: Check if each record contains a taxonomic group.
Comment: An informative warning will be issued.

Check: Check if the taxa in column `accepted' belongs to only one taxonomic group.
Check if the AMBI-file exist.
Check if the AMBI-file can be read.
Check if the AMBI-file contains columns TAXON and GROUP.
Check on duplicated records.
Comment: Duplicated records will be removed.

Check: Check if AMBI-classes are permissible (I, II, III, IV, V).
Check if the ITI-file exist.
Check if the ITI-file can be read.
Check if the ITI-file contains columns TAXON and GROUP.
Check on duplicated records.
Comment: Duplicated records will be removed.

Check: Check if ITI-classes are permissible (I, II, III, IV).
Check if the habitat-reference-file exists.
Check if the habitat-reference-file can be read.
Check if any indices are specified. If that's not the case an error will be raised.
Check if all indices are valid. Valid indices are N, LNN, S, D, SN, SNA, H, L, AMBI, ITI, PIE, N2.
Check if all compulsory column names are available. Compulsory names are: OBJECTID, RELAREA, HABITAT, and BAD*, REF* where * denotes an index.
Check if duplicated records are available.
Comment: Duplicated records will be removed.
